data.title: Music Man Unveils All-New Mike Herrera StingRay Bass
data.meta_description: For more than two decades MXPX bassist Mike Herrera has wielded a custom StingRay, modified to his unique specifications. Now, Herrera’s secret weapon is…
data.text:
Introducing the Ernie Ball Music Man Mike Herrera StingRay bass. For more than two decades MXPX frontman and bassist Mike Herrera has wielded a custom StingRay, modified to his unique specifications.

Now, Herrera’s secret weapon is available to the public. The Mike Herrera StingRay features an ash body with Seafoam Green finish, a matching headstock, an engraved white pearloid pickguard, passive electronics (no battery required), and a custom laser-engraved Artist Series neckplate.

Having the appearance of a traditional 2-band EQ StingRay, the Herrera StingRay’s pickup is actually wired straight to the jack with three dummy knobs. Additional features include a maple neck and fretboard, 21 nickel frets, six bolt neck, and alnico magnets. New for 2022 the bass is available in a limited edition “Flat Black” package that includes a satin finish, numbered neck plate, certificate of authenticity signed by Mike Herrera and a Mono case. The Flat Black package is limited to 10 globally.

Model Mike Herrera StingRay Bass

Size 13-1/2″ wide x 1-5/8″ thick x 44-7/8″ long (34.3 cm wide, 4.1 cm thick, 114.0 cm long)

Body Wood Ash

Bridge Music Man® Chrome plated, hardened steel bridge plate with stainless steel saddles

Pickguard Engraved White Pearloid, 3-ply with black center layer

Scale Length 34″ (86.4 cm)

Neck Radius 11″ (27.9 cm)

Frets 21 high profile wide, nickel silver

Neck Width 1-11/16″ (42.9mm) at nut, 2-1/2″ (63.5 mm) at last fret

Neck Wood Maple

Fingerboard Maple

Fret Markers Dot inlay

Neck Finish Gunstock oil and hand-rubbed special wax blend

Neck Colors Natural

Tuning Machines Schaller BM, with tapered string posts

Neck Attachment 6 bolts – perfect alignment with no shifting

Controls 3 dummy knobs, pickup wired directly to jack

Pickups Music Man® humbucking with Alnico magnets

Left Handed no

Strings 50w-70w-85w-105w (Regular Slinky Bass #2832)
